divs: Sighting DetailsI was starting my night watch shift sitting in my car. My care was facing west. I looked to the horizon and saw an amazing formation of bright red lights which were rising from the horizon. The formation was so big that I could not cover them all with my hand. The formation took up about a third of all my vision. I put my jacket on and grabbed my binoculars then got out of my car to get a better look. I propped the binoculars on a fire hydrant that was next to my car in order to steady the view. I saw a few of them close up with the binoculars. All I could make out was some sort of very intense bright red orb shape. I then started walking down JR Drive towards the lights to see if I could tell how far they were from my location. My perspective never changed so I assume the formation was very very far away. From the right side to the left it must have been a 50 mile spread. It was in a busy part of town so there must be hundreds of people who saw it. I had no camera with me but made a drawing of the formation which I will make available.
Summary: Symmetrical formation of 8 to 10 red lights
